messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Harry Potter, again.
messages.msgSnippet: **Maybe Roald Dahl was Christian, I don t know.  I should go ask her, but I m afriad she d take it wrong.** I m pretty sure some of Roald Dahl s adult stories
messages.messageBody:
**Maybe Roald Dahl was Christian, I don't know. I should go ask her,
but I'm
afriad she'd take it wrong.**


I'm pretty sure some of Roald Dahl's adult stories were published in
Playboy. <g> But you might not want to tell her, even to score a point,
because she might ban her kids Dahl books.

Betsy

PS Not that I care, but J. K. Rowling is a Christian who attends the
church of Scotland. She just doesn't wave her religion around like a
flag when she is interviewed.

messages.subject: Re: Harry Potter, again.
messages.msgSnippet: ... This is just a teeny, tiny little rant and it has nothing to do with Harry Potter, but it makes me so mad that the same people who protest abortion
messages.messageBody:
>>>She was a single
> parent<<<

This is just a teeny, tiny little rant and it has nothing to do with
Harry Potter, but it makes me so mad that the same people who protest
abortion criticize single mothers!!!

Ok, you can continue your discussion in peace now.

Sorcha

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Harry Potter, again.
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s not about poor Harry.  It s about J.K. Rowlings.  She was a single parents, and she s promoting the anti-christ.  Or so says the other homeschooler in
messages.messageBody:
5/7/03 17:05:

> The strange thing is that they think Roald Dahl is fine and his books are
> filled with magic and kids getting the better of their parents but Harry
> Potter is evil.

It's not about poor Harry. It's about J.K. Rowlings. She was a single
parents, and she's promoting the anti-christ. Or so says the other
homeschooler in town here (there's one), who was appalled that my son was
reading book 4.

Maybe Roald Dahl was Christian, I don't know. I should go ask her, but I'm
afriad she'd take it wrong.

brenda
